Farmer.description: A person who grows crops or raises livestock.

Laborer.description: An unskilled or semi-skilled worker in various industries.

Servant.description: A person employed in household work.

Blacksmith.description: A person who forges and shapes metal objects, often including horseshoes.

Weaver.description: A person who weaves fabric, often in a textile mill or at home.

Cooper.description: A person who makes or repairs wooden barrels and casks.

Carpenter.description: A person who builds or repairs wooden structures and furniture.

Shoemaker.description: A person who makes and repairs shoes.

Tailor.description: A person who makes, repairs, or alters clothing.

Miller.description: A person who grinds grain into flour using a mill.

Fisherman.description: A person who catches fish for trade or consumption.

Tanner.description: A person who processes animal hides into leather.

Chandler.description: A person who makes candles or soap.

Merchant.description: A person who buys and sells goods for profit.

Clerk.description: A person responsible for keeping financial or written records.

Teacher.description: A person who instructs students in a school or privately.

Minister.description: A religious leader responsible for spiritual guidance.

Doctor.description: A person trained in medical treatment and diagnosis.

Lawyer.description: A person who represents clients in legal matters.

Soldier.description: A person who serves in an army or military force.
